judges: Before Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The Court being equally divided, the order of the Superior Court is affirmed.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: James D. Crawford, Assistant District Attorney, with him Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Altizer, Appellant.
Argued November 13, 1969.
Before Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
Dennis H. Dismam,, for appellant.
James D. Crawford, Assistant District Attorney, with him Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
January 9, 1970:
